definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached

sentences.english: Wrong conclusion is prone to come from comparison without historical analysis.
sentences.chinese: 沒有歷史分析的比較，容易產生不當比附。

sentences.english: The giraffe grown in Africa was mistaken for the Qilin (Chinese unicorn)in the Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 明代將非洲產的長頸鹿比附爲麒麟。

sentences.english: The studies of the history of Chinese philosophy in the past days often followed the line of western philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 以往中國哲學史的研究往往比附於西方哲學。

sentences.english: In this connection, Li Shangyin's poems allow no farfetched comparison or realistic interpretation.
sentences.chinese: 李商隱的詩不可牽強比附，去做指實的說解。

definition: to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
to esteem/to revere/to think highly of sb
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
